summary: In this context, decane and n-tetradecane are part of a selected set of compounds identified in breath analysis to distinguish between allergic asthmatic children and control subjects. Both compounds are alkanes included in a pattern that aids in the non-invasive diagnosis of asthma, highlighting their relevance in metabolic pathways associated with the condition. However, the specific relationship between decane and n-tetradecane is not elaborated upon beyond their inclusion in the same diagnostic model.
